data.text:
üöÄ Exciting developments in the world of high-frequency trading! üöÄ Ken Griffin‚Äôs Citadel Securities has made a significant move by appointing former Goldman Sachs executive Jim Esposito as president. Esposito, known for his expertise and leadership, will join the Miami-based market maker in September, reporting directly to CEO Peng Zhao. This strategic hire showcases Citadel Securities' bold ambitions to rival traditional Wall Street banks. As a dominant force in high-speed trading, Citadel Securities handles about a third of all US retail stock trades and is rapidly expanding into new asset classes and global markets. Esposito's addition to the team is set to drive the firm‚Äôs growth even further. ‚ÄúI am excited to join Citadel Securities, a next-generation capital markets firm with world-class talent and cutting-edge analytics and technology,‚Äù Esposito said. His primary focus will be on expanding the firm‚Äôs client base and forging new partnerships. With Citadel Securities on a path of significant expansion and innovation, this move signals a thrilling period of growth and opportunity. Stay tuned as Citadel Securities continues to disrupt and lead the trading world! üåçüìà #Finance #HighFrequencyTrading #CitadelSecurities #GoldmanSachs #JimEsposito #MarketMakers #Trading #Investment #KenGriffin

We would like to thank ADIA Lab for inviting us to present our paper, ‚ÄúBuilding Probabilistic Causal Models using Collective Intelligence,‚Äù written in collaboration with Alexander Denev. In our presentation, we highlighted the usefulness of Bayesian networks and the complexity of their creation, before explaining the method we developed to generate them automatically through the Causality Link platform, with an example on the prediction of the price of crude oil. Congratulations to our fellow finalists and to our team members Dr. Olav Laudy and Allen Ginsberg for co-authoring this breakthrough research! If you‚Äôd like to learn more about Causality Link, visit our website at https://causalitylink.com/. To learn more about ADIA Lab‚Äôs competition for causal research in investments and to read this whitepaper, click here: https://lnkd.in/dNfs2Uut #CausalAI #ArtificialIntelligence #ThoughtLeadership #Research

I‚Äôm thrilled to share a recent project at Middlebury Emerging Market & Quantitative Strategies, where we strive to connect global perspectives and quantitative interests with the global capital markets. Shout out to Henry Zhan for his pivotal role. üìà Project Spotlight: This study delves into characteristic variables of identified stock manipulations in China during 2020, analyzing 42 manipulated stocks against a backdrop of 99 blue-chip stocks. üõ†Ô∏è Approach: Our methodology involved hypothesis testing and logistic regression to understand patterns of stock manipulation behaviors. üí° Key Findings: We identified Tradable Share Volume as a significant indicator. This underlines the risk of trading overly-diluted companies in the Chinese Market. What are your thoughts?

19

Today at 2:00 PM EST learn about Unmasking Stochastic Volatility in Discontinuous Continuity Approximations and Extracting VIX Optionality Directly from SPX Implied Volatilities Dilip Madan, Professor Emeritus of Mathematical Finance at the University of Maryland - Robert H. Smith School of Business will discuss how, when it comes to volatility, Brownian motion is blind and unable to distinguish three important aspects of motion. These are speed, the rate of motion in time, scale, the rate of motion in space, and the degree of continuity in motion or the relativity of speed to scale at small scales. The third is lost by being continuous, the first two are identified with each other by the scaling property. By focusing attention on discontinuous approximations to continuity instead, one is able to distinguish all three and then ask what is stochastic when volatility is stochastic. Is it speed, scale, or the degree of continuity? Models of stochastic speed are formulated by adapting current speeds going forward to realized speeds looking back. When they are calibrated to SPX option prices it is shown that they directly imply, via an endogenous construction of the volatility of volatility, the prices for options on both volatility and variance. Stylized facts observed in VIX option prices are then directly derived from SPX option prices. To learn more visit: https://lnkd.in/eQjjaD4Z #quantbootcamp #arpm #mathematicalfinance #equitytrading #datascience

Goldman Sachs on Monday posted first-quarter profit and revenue that topped analysts‚Äô expectations, fueled by a surge in trading and investment banking revenue. Here‚Äôs what the company reported: Earnings: $11.58 per share, vs. $8.56 expected, according to LSEG Revenue: $14.21 billion, vs. expected $12.92 billion The bank said profit jumped 28% to $4.13 billion, or $11.58 per share, from the year earlier period, thanks to a rebound in capital markets activities. Revenue rose 16% to $14.21 billion, topping analysts‚Äô estimate by more than $1 billion. https://lnkd.in/gxRFiGSK

Bain Capital, a private investment firm, completed the acquisition of a minority stake in Sikich, a Chicago-based investment banking firm offering expert M&A and capital markets advisory services tailored to the middle market, for $250m. "This is an incredibly exciting time for our organization. We've been executing an ambitious growth and diversification strategy to capitalize on unique and favorable market conditions within an evolving professional services landscape, more than doubling in size over the last five years alone. Partnering with a leading global investor like Bain Capital is a testament to our strategy and provides us with additional meaningful resources and extensive knowledge to advance our mission and deliver on our value proposition to employees and clients," Christopher Geier, Sikich CEO. Sikich (led by Christopher Geier and Ryan Spohn) was advised by PJT Partners, Holland & Knight LLP, and Vedder Price. Bain Capital (led by Cristian Jitianu) was advised by Hunton Andrews Kurth LLP, Kirkland & Ellis, and Stanton (led by Scott Lessne). #MergersAcquisitionsDivestitures #Advisory #BusinessServices #InvestmentBanking

Leading global private investment firm, Bain Capital, has announced its plans to acquire PowerSchool, providing a fantastic investment opportunity for Health Savings Account (HSA) investors. üíº The Deal: Bain Capital will purchase PowerSchool at an impressive price of $22.80 per share in cash. This amounts to a remarkable 37% premium over the company's closing price on May 7. Existing investors, Vista Equity and Onex, will also be part of this transformational deal. üìà A Smart Investment Move: Healthcare and education technology continue to thrive and grow, making PowerSchool an excellent addition to any HSA investor's portfolio. With the rising emphasis on digital learning platforms and the increasing demand for efficient administrative tools in schools, PowerSchool is perfectly positioned for sustained growth. üåü Empowering Your Financial Journey: Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to leverage your HSA account and invest in the future of education technology. Act now to maximize your potential returns, secure your financial wellness, and support the transformation of the education sector. Let's make a positive impact on both health and education! üöÄ Take Action Today: #HSA #Investing #Healthcare #Health #Family #Wellness #PowerfulInvestments
